Reliability Markov Models are Becoming Unreliable
Kevin M. Greenan and Jay J. Wylie
Concerns with Markov Models Traditionally used for reliability analysis Assumes exponential distribution Does not match real failure distributions Elerath & Pecht, DSN 2007

But, do Markov models provide correct intuition? Sector failures (latent, scrubbing & bit errors) Rebuild in multi-disk FT systems Novel erasure codes (e.g. non-MDS XOR-based codes) Heterogeneous devices
n disks in the array is the disk failure rate is the disk repair rate DL is a data loss event
Concurrent rebuild policy Multiple failed disks recover simultaneously
Non-failed state once last failed disk recovers
Memoryless Markov model ignores rebuilt data! Markov model MTTDL 2x less than simulation
Conclusion Concerns with Markov models Is naively extending RAID5 model wrong? Other issues with modeling sector failures, etc. Are Markov models good enough? New models?
